solution_line_template: First find how much money Bill makes every week by multiplying his hourly rate by the number of hours he works each week: ${hourly_rate}/hour * {hours_per_week} hours/week = $<<{hourly_rate}*{hours_per_week}={weekly_earnings}>>{weekly_earnings}/week

Then multiply that number by the number of weeks per month to find his monthly earnings: ${weekly_earnings}/week * {weeks_per_month} weeks/month = $<<{weekly_earnings}*{weeks_per_month}={monthly_earnings}>>{monthly_earnings}/month

Then multiply his monthly earnings by the number of months in a year to find his annual income: ${monthly_earnings}/month * {months_per_year} months/year = $<<{monthly_earnings}*{months_per_year}={annual_income}>>{annual_income}/year.

This income means Bill gets a 50% monthly healthcare subsidy from the government. Multiply the cost of the premium by 50% to find the monthly cost Bill pays: ${normal_monthly_price}/month * {subsidy_percent_decimal} = $<<{normal_monthly_price}*{subsidy_percent_decimal}={bill_monthly_cost}>>{bill_monthly_cost}/month

Finally, multiply Bill's monthly cost by the number of months in a year to find his annual cost: ${bill_monthly_cost}/month * {months_per_year} months/year = $<<{bill_monthly_cost}*{months_per_year}={bill_annual_cost}>>{bill_annual_cost}/year
